text: General elections were held in Montserrat in February 1983.General Election Results -February 1983 Caribbean Elections The result was a victory for the People's Liberation Movement (PLM), which won five of the seven seats in the Legislative Council. PLM leader John Osborne remained Chief Minister. ==Campaign== A total of 22 candidates contested the elections; the PLM and the Progressive Democratic Party both nominated seven, the United National Front nominated four, with the other four candidates running as independents, three of which contested the Northern constituency.Howard A Fergus (1985) Rule Britannia: Politics in British Montserrat, University Centre, p103 ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Party !Votes !% !Seats !+/– |- |align=left|People's Liberation Movement||2,517||55.0||5||–2 |- |align=left|Progressive Democratic Party||1,587||34.7||2||+2 |- |align=left|United National Front||251||5.5||0||New |- |align=left|Independents||219||4.8||0||0 |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes||64||–||–||– |- |align=left|Total||4,638||100||7||0 |- |align=left|Registered voters/turnout||6,213||74.7||–||– |- |align=left colspan=5|Source: EmmanuelPatrick A Emmanuel (1992) Elections & Party Systems in the Commonwealth Caribbean 1944-1991, Caribbean Development Research Service, pp10–24 |} ===Elected MPs=== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:left !Constituency !Elected MP !Party |- |Central||E Dyer||Progressive Democratic Party |- |Eastern||N Tuitt||People's Liberation Movement |- |North- Western||John Osborne||People's Liberation Movement |- |Northern||J B Chalmers||People's Liberation Movement |- |Plymouth||F Margetson||People's Liberation Movement |- |Southern||Percival Austin Bramble||Progressive Democratic Party |- |Windward||David Brandt||People's Liberation Movement |} ==References== 1983 Category:1983 elections in the Caribbean Category:1983 in Montserrat Category:1983 elections in British Overseas Territories Category:February 1983 events in North America
title: 1983 Montserratian general election
